etymologies: late Middle English: from the given name Mary (probably referring to the Virgin) + dialect gold, denoting the corn or garden marigold in Old English

definitions: a plant of the daisy family, typically with yellow, orange, or copper-brown flowers, that is widely cultivated as an ornamental.

notes.text: Genera Tagetes (the French and African marigolds) and Calendula (the common marigold or pot marigold), family Compositae

shortDefinitions: plant of daisy family with yellow, orange, or copper-brown flowers

definitions: used in names of other plants with yellow flowers, e.g., corn marigold, marsh marigold.
shortDefinitions: used in names of plants with yellow flowers
